title: English pub scraps snail race as cold makes competitors sluggish
text: February 24, 2018 / 11:38 AM / Updated 24 minutes ago English pub scraps snail race as cold makes competitors sluggish Reuters Staff 1 Min Read LONDON (Reuters) - An English pub has canceled a charity snail race scheduled to take place on Saturday after unseasonably icy weather made potential competitors too slow to compete. “The cold snap has led to a medical problem with our racing snails - it’s called hibernation,” the Dartmoor Union Inn in southwest England said on its Facebook page. Temperatures across much of Europe are below normal for the time of year, and British weather forecasters have warned of bitterly cold winds and snow that could disrupt transport and cut off rural communities over the coming week. England’s public health authority said on Friday the prolonged cold weather posed a danger to elderly people and young children if they could not heat their homes. The Dartmoor Union Inn said it planned to reschedule what it had billed as “The 1st International Snail Grand National”, in aid of a local air ambulance service, once the weather warms up. Reporting by David Milliken; Editing by Mark Potter
